Two main reasons:

1. Sion's ult is intended to be attractive in particular as an initiation spell. Adding a reward to it for kills however lead to players sitting on it until someone was low enough to be killed. That discouraged the more interesting (longer range) uses of the spell.

2. One of Sion's intended weaknesses is lack of back line access. This mechanic, if ever relevant, clashes with that by letting him pass through the front line that should be consistently blocking his ult.

Tested on the PBE but was deemed too awkward an interaction. Wasn't blatantly OP or UP, but moreso hard to tell if you would get the kill and keep going, or not kill and stop, which could really screw some players over. Think about it. You want to ult say mid lane, you ult, think it WON'T kill, but when it does, you keep going and are now past turrets. 

Or, you won't think it will kill, and the enemy you were targeting was near a wall. Think you're safe, nope, you get the kill but are now also stunned against a wall. The lack of knowledge of a kill happening or not would discourage many Sions from using ult out of this worry.
Could be some indicator while he's ulting if a direct hit will kill them.

Since there is significant time between when he ults and when he hits his target, this indicator could be seriously misleading as they have plenty of time to heal or regen and now the indicator dissappears after Sion already burned his ult. Not to mention since his is physical damage (as opposed to Chogath) the indicator could get really wonky if Taric is walking by etc.
This is a bad idea for the same reason that it would be a bad idea to allow ashe's ult to do this.
